bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.head: The United States of America vs. George Allen, George Hawkins, and Thomas Dolan. District Court for the District of Alaska, Division No. Two
body.p: George Allen, George Hawkins, and Thomas Dolan are accused by the grand jury of the District of Alaska, Division No. Two, by this indictment, of the crime of robbery committed as follows: The said George Allen, George Hawkins, and Thomas Dolan, on the 21st day of December, nineteen hundred, in the District aforesaid, did wrongfully, unlawfully, and feloniously take, steal, and carry away, from the person of R.J. Embleton, and against his will and by force and violence to his person, the following described personal property, namely: one piece of paper money, of the Dominion of Canada, of the denomination and value of One Hundred Dollars; two pieces of paper money of the Dominion of Canada, each of the denomination and value of Fifty Dollars; four pieces of paper money of the Dominion of Canada, each of the denomination and value of twenty dollars; one piece of paper money of the Dominion of Canada of the denomination and value of ten dollars, a more particular description of each or any of the sai pieces of paper money aforesaid, being to the grand jury unknown, also one gold watch of the value of seventy-five dollaars, all the personal property of the said R.J. Embleton. contrary to the form of the statute in such case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the United States.
Dated at Nome, in the District aforesaid, the 22nd day of January, nineteen hundred and one. Joesph K. Wood District Attorney.
Witnesses examined before the Grand Jury: R.J. Embleton. L.C. Cherry. A.J. Cody. W.F. Hobbs. J. Farhnworth. B.H. Dittmer. Fred Liebe.

Endorsed: No. 49 Criminal. District Court United States, District of Alaska, Second Division. THE UNITED STATES vs. GEORGE ALLEN, GEORGE HAWKINS, AND THOMAS DOLAN. Indictment. A True Bill. E.S. Ingraham. Foreman. Filed in the U.S. District Court, District of Alaska? Second Division. Jan'y 23, 1901. Geo.V.Borchsenius, Clerk. John T. Reed, Deputy. Joesph K. Wood U. S. Attorney. Vol 1 Page 41.
